item.name: Ioun Stone, Free Action
entries: 当这个青色的菱形物体绕过你的头顶时，你不会受到困难地形的影响，并且在逃避被抓捕或限制的能力检查中具有优势。

item.name: Ioun Stone, Greater Light
entries: 这个灿烂的金色球体在半径20英尺的范围内发出亮光，在另外20英尺的范围内发出暗光。这种光是太阳光，会影响对太阳光敏感或对太阳光过度敏感的生物。

item.name: Ioun Stone, Greater Protection
entries: 当这块石头绕着你的脑袋转时，你对一种伤害有免疫力。

item.name: Ioun Stone, Magic Resistance
entries: 当这个透明的球体围绕着你的头部时，你对法术和其他魔法效果的救赎有优势。

item.name: Ioun Stone, Mental Acuity
entries: 只要这个紫红色的立方体围绕着你的头部，你就可以随意施展{@i message}咒语和{@i detect thoughts}法术。

item.name: Ioun Stone, Might
entries: 在每次短期和长期休息结束时，你会获得15个临时命中率。

item.name: Ioun Stone, Mirroring
entries: 当这个镜像立方体环绕你的头部时，你在面对凝视攻击和其他需要眼神接触的攻击时有优势。

item.name: Ioun Stone, Protection
entries: 当这块石头围绕着你的头部时，你对某种类型的伤害有抵抗力。

rows: 斑驳的黄色和白色长方形

item.name: Ioun Stone, Protection from Weapons
entries: 当这颗栗色的星星围绕着你的头部时，你对非魔法武器的击打、刺穿和砍伤有抵抗力。

item.name: Ioun Stone, Spirit Storage
entries: 如果你因暴力而死，你的灵魂会进入这个透明的粉色球体。只要在死亡后一年内施法，并且石头完好无损，一个{@i greater restoration}的咒语就能让你的灵魂回到你的身体。不管是对你的身体还是对石头施法，只要两者在同一个平面上，就没有关系。被恢复后，你的身体将恢复到死亡前的状态。你的命中率为0，但会在1小时内保持稳定和无意识，即使在恢复命中率后也是如此。

item.name: Ioun Stone, Translation
entries: 当这块浅蓝色的棱镜绕着你的头转时，你可以理解并说所有的口语。这块石头并没有给你任何理解书面语言的特殊能力。

item.name: Ioun Stone, Weariness
entries: 当这个银色球体绕着你的头顶运行时，你不能被惊讶或受到偷袭。

item.name: Ioun Stone, Water Walking
entries: 只要这个淡黄色的菱形围绕着你的头，你就可以在水面上行走，仿佛是困难的地形。

item.name: Iron Bow
entries: 这个{@i longbow +2}是由神奇的柔性铁制成的。当你拉回弓弦时，它会自己产生箭。此外，你可以命令这把弓向300英尺内你能看到的目标发射一道闪电。一旦你使用这个能力，你就不能再使用它，直到第二天的黎明。

items.name: Curse
entries: 这张弓是受诅咒的。适应它就会把诅咒延伸到你身上。只要你还被诅咒，你就不愿意和这把弓分开，一直把它带在身上。在与此武器相适应时，你在使用此武器以外的其他武器进行攻击时有劣势。
在几周或几个月的时间里，你的取向会转变为混乱的善。此外，你将无法拒绝任何呈现在你面前的英雄事迹，无论它看起来多么危险或不可能。你一般不愿意让别人在这些任务中帮助你，但也可以在困难的情况下被说服。

item.name: Ironstar Mace
entries: 这是一个{@i mace +1}。它非常轻，但也牢不可破。它有5个电荷。攻击时，你可以声明你要花费一个电荷来进行粉碎性打击。如果你击中了，你可以掷出一个额外的伤害模子，目标必须做一个DC 17的宪法救赎，否则会被击晕1分钟。生物可以在它的每个回合开始时尝试一次新的救赎，如果成功则结束该效果。此外，如果目标穿着非魔法胸甲、半身甲或板甲，DM必须滚动一个D6。在掷出1或2时，盔甲会被击碎并变得无用。
每天黎明时分，法杖会重新获得1d3个已消耗的炸药。

item.name: Ivy Bracelet
entries: 这个看起来很脆弱的手镯是由活的常春藤制成的。佩戴它时，你可以与植物交流，就像你们有共同的语言一样。
这个手镯有5个电荷。你可以用你的行动消耗一个电荷来施展以下的法术：{@i entangle}（1个电荷），{@i plant growth}（3个电荷），或{@i transport via plants}（5个电荷）。
手镯每天在黎明时分重新获得1d4+1个已消耗的能量。

item.name: Jade Scepter of Defending
entries: 这根白玉棒的功能是（%0%）。它在被持有时不断发光，在5英尺范围内发出亮光，在另外5英尺范围内发出暗光。如果你拿着权杖并专注于它（就像专注于一个法术一样），不做其他动作，你可以免疫来自非魔法攻击的击打、穿刺和砍击伤害。

item.name: Javelin of Distance
entries: 这个（%0%）的范围是90/130英尺。

item.name: Jewelry of Equus
entries: 这件珠宝几乎可以采取任何形式；耳环、手镯和吊坠是最常见的类型。根据命令，你可以命令珠宝变成野兽的形态，或者把它变回珠宝的形态。它保持这两种形态的时间长短没有限制。
在动物形态下，它与同类型的普通生物相同，只是它是一个构筑物，其智力为2（-4）。如果动物受到伤害，它只能在动物形态下进行治疗，如果它被杀死了，它就会恢复到珠宝形态，珠宝变成非魔法的，而且这个野兽不能再被召唤出来。
掷一个D8来决定生物类型。

item.name: Key of Entrance
entries: 当你把这把钥匙放在任何锁着的门、盖子或舱口上，并说出命令词，锁就会打开。这把钥匙会反击并驱散（%0%）。这把钥匙也会使锁内或锁本身的一部分的任何陷阱失效，但也会自动触发门上或铰链上还没有被解除的任何陷阱。
一旦你使用这个能力，你就不能再使用它，直到下一个黄昏。

item.name: Key of Inquiry
entries: 这把钥匙可以用来 "解开 "一个生物所隐藏的真相。该生物可以尝试一个DC17的智慧救赎动作。如果失败，该生物必须在其能力范围内如实、完整、清楚地回答三个问题。

item.name: Key of Reunion
entries: 这些钥匙成对出现。如果一把钥匙平放在手里，只要它们在同一个平面上，它就会无一例外地指向另一把钥匙。

item.name: Key of Silence
entries: 当你用你的行动将这把钥匙指向60英尺内的一个目标并使其转动时，该目标必须做一个DC17的魅力救赎，否则就会失去所有说话的能力，因为你锁定了它的声音。该生物可以在它的每个回合结束时尝试一次新的蓄力，如果成功则结束该效果。如果一分钟后没有成功，该生物就会哑巴24小时。你可以选择在任何时候通过使用行动将钥匙转到另一个方向来解锁它的声音。一个（%0%）也会结束这个条件。
一旦你锁定了一个目标的声音，你就不能再使用这个键，直到第二天。

item.name: Key of Storage
entries: 当握住并转动时，这把钥匙会露出一扇薄薄的门，那是一个超维的 "储物柜"，里面有100立方英尺的容积。当你解锁这个空间时，你可以选择是让门向上打开（就像打开一个搁在地上的箱子）还是向外打开（就像打开一个柜子）。与{@i bag of holding}不同的是，它没有重量限制；它可以容纳任何可以放入该空间的东西。然而，和(1%)一样，袋子里的呼吸生物可以存活到等于10除以生物数量的分钟数（最少1分钟），之后它们就开始窒息。
由于这个东西采用了超维空间，把它放在一个{@i bag of holding}或类似的物体里会导致两个物品都被摧毁，并且打开一个通往星界的裂缝。

item.name: Mace of Crushing
entries: 这（%0%）对物体和结构造成双倍伤害。

entries.name: Base items
entries: 这个物品变体可以应用于以下基本物品。

item.name: Mace of Pain
entries: 这把重锤对攻击和伤害卷有+2的加成，它的每一次打击都会造成难以置信的痛苦。在一次成功的攻击中，目标的最大命中率会降低，降低的量等于该武器造成的伤害的一半，四舍五入。建筑物、元素、恶魔、不死生物和无法感受到疼痛的生物对这种消耗免疫。
此外，只要你在使用该武器时掷出关键一击，或者你的总掷数高于20（即使不是关键一击），目标就会非常痛苦，以至于它被击晕，直到下一回合结束。

entries.name: Base items
entries: 这个物品变体可以应用于以下基本物品。

item.name: Mage Wine
entries: 如果你有能力施展巫师的法术列表中的法术，那么当你喝下这种丰富的红色药水时，你会立即恢复一个你在当天早些时候施展的法术槽。掷一个D4来决定槽的等级。如果你没有使用过该等级的槽，你会恢复你所使用过的最低等级的槽。

item.name: Magical Chess Set, Type Ⅰ
entries: 这套国际象棋是由罕见的镶嵌木料制成的，并有精致的雕刻作品。
这个单人版与你对弈，并提供一个可接受的游戏。它能够慢慢向你学习，最终会成为一个更强大的对手。
如果需要它的实际统计数据，这套国际象棋开始时的熟练度奖励为-2，但每赢两局就增加1，没有上限。如果一年内没人下它，它就会恢复到+0的奖励。

item.name: Magical Chess Set, Type Ⅱ
entries: 这套国际象棋是由罕见的镶嵌木料制成的，并有精致的雕刻作品。
这种类型的（%0%）是成对出现的。如果两套棋盘都正确地设置了所有的棋子，那么只要两套棋盘在同一个平面上，在一个棋盘上走的棋就会在另一套棋盘上得到反映。你可以命令这套棋在另一个棋手下棋时发出鸣叫。

item.name: Magical Fountain
entries: 这是一种大型、华丽的水泉，通常由花岗岩或大理石制成，通常雕刻着仙女从瓮中洒水的雕像，跳跃的海豚从喷水孔中喷水，神话般的野兽吐出水柱，小精灵或小男孩撒尿，等等。这些喷泉通常在意想不到的地方被发现，例如在一个被遗忘的地牢里的一个奇怪的大房间的中心，或者在一个被怪物困扰的坏境深处。
从这些喷泉中饮用的水是有魔力的，虽然不一定有好处。每个喷泉在 "干涸 "之前会产生1d20杯饮料，尽管它继续产生非魔法水。经过一段固定的时间--通常是一个月、一年零一天或一个世纪--它就会恢复其魔法能力。
神奇的喷泉没有连接到任何明显的管道上。任何试图移动喷泉，拆开它以找到水源，或将管道连接到它以转移水的行为都会导致喷泉不可逆转地破裂。从喷泉中抽取的水在1小时后会失去效力。
每个魔法喷泉只产生一个效果（如果喷泉的描述告诉你要掷骰子来决定结果，那么每个喝水的人都要掷骰子），除非DM选择让一个喷泉有多种效果。除非另有规定，否则效果会持续2d8+10小时，其中（%0%）包括短期或长期休息的时间。

rows: {@b Fountain of Age.} 你变得很老。你的力量、灵巧和体质各减少1d4，而且你在依靠听觉的智慧（感知）检查中处于劣势。

entries: {@b Fountain of Altered Attributes.} 掷一个骰子。如果是奇数，你的一项属性会增加1d4。如果是偶数，它就会减少这个数量。掷一个D6来决定哪个属性被改变。

rows: {@b Fountain of Amnesia.} 你在这段时间内失去所有的记忆。你实际上并没有失去你的任何种族或阶级能力，你的盟友可以尝试向你解释它们是如何运作的。每次你第一次尝试使用你的能力时，你需要进行DC11智力检查（如果是种族能力），DC13（如果是阶级特征），或DC15（如果是原型特征）来弄清楚。
{@b Fountain of Bravery and Cowardice.} 掷一个骰子。如果是奇数，你可以在效果持续的时间内，以优势掷出针对受惊吓的救赎。如果是偶数，你就会以劣势掷出这种救赎。如果骰子掉了下来，你就会在持续时间内对一些平凡而无害的东西产生严重的恐惧症。

entries: {@b Fountain of Detection.} 你获得探测某些事物存在的能力。其效果与同名的法术相同，只需要你在主动使用该能力时集中精力。掷一个D4来决定你能探测到什么。
{@b 1:} {@i Detect evil and good}.
{@b 2:} {@i Detect magic}.
{@b 3:} {@i Detect poison and disease}.
{@b 4:} {@i Detect thoughts}.

rows: {@b Fountain of Disbelief.}你看到的下一个怪物，以及那个特定物种的所有怪物，对你来说将突然不存在了。你只是会拒绝相信它的存在。如果有人向你指出这些怪物中的一个，你要么什么都看不到，要么看到一个类似类型的怪物。怪物仍然可以看到你并进行攻击；你会相信你是被其他东西、被一个看不见的生物或被一个盟友伤害了。

entries: {@b Fountain of Disease.}你患上一种令人不快的、不雅观的、但不致命的疾病。在患病期间，你在某种类型的卷轴上有劣势。一个{@i lesser restoration}将结束疾病。掷一个D6来决定你在什么方面有劣势。
{@b 1:}使用物理属性的蓄力攻击。
{@b 2:}使用精神属性的蓄力攻击。
{@b 3:}使用物理属性的能力检查。
{@b 4:}使用精神属性的能力检查。
{@b 5:} 基于力量的攻击卷。
{@b 6:}基于灵巧的攻击卷。

rows: {@b Fountain of Enchantment.} 掷一个骰子。如果是奇数，你会疯狂地爱上你看到的第一个人。如果是偶数，你会对你看到的第一个人产生强烈的恨意。如果骰子落空，你就会对这个人完全漠不关心；无论这个人做什么，你都不会关心。
{@b Fountain of Flight.} 你获得以60英尺的速度飞行的能力。但是，你不能高于30英尺，也不能低于离地1英尺；当这个能力生效时，你不能接触地面。
{@b Fountain of Geases.}一个被困在喷泉水里的灵魂对你施加了一个{@i geas}，除非你在DC17智慧救赎上成功。你完全知道这个诅咒的条款。

{@b Fountain of Ghostliness.} 掷一个骰子。如果是奇数，你会变成隐形人。你仍然是实体，仍然可以被听到、触摸到和闻到。如果是偶数，你会变成无实体，你的衣服和盔甲也是如此。你的其他物品，包括背包，会掉到地上。在无体状态下，你可以在生物和物体中移动，就像它们是困难的地形一样，如果你在一个物体中结束你的回合，你会受到5（1d10）力的伤害。你可以施展不需要物质成分的法术，或者使用其他不需要与实体物体互动的能力。

entries: {@b Fountain of Greed.}你开始迷恋收集某种类型的物品。掷一个D6来决定它是什么。
{@b 1:} 硬币，不管有多少，多重，或面额。
{@b 2:} 衣服，无论其类型、尺寸、物种或性别，或条件如何，都是为其设计的。
{@b 3:}武器，即使你不能使用它（你{@i can}被劝说好心地让你的盟友保留他们的武器，只要你能看到并偶尔触摸它们）。
{@b 4:}玩具、小玩意和各种无用的纪念品。
{@b 5:} 有趣的岩石。
{@b 6:} 你杀死的怪物的牙齿、角、爪子、头皮、皮毛和/或眼球。

rows: {@b Fountain of Hastiness and Slowness.} 掷一个骰子。如果是奇数，速度增加10英尺。如果是偶数，你的速度就会减少10英尺。
{@b Fountain of Healing.} 5d8的命中率恢复给你。如果适用的话，你也会失去失明、失聪、麻痹和中毒的状况，一个等级的疲惫，并将你减少的命中率最大值恢复到正常。

entries: {@b Fountain of Immunity.} 你获得对一种伤害的免疫力，并掷出一个骰子。如果是奇数，你获得对第二种类型伤害的抵抗力。在偶数时，你获得对第二种类型伤害的脆弱性。如果骰子掉在桌子上，你将获得对第二种类型伤害的抵抗力和对第三种类型伤害的脆弱性。掷一个D8来决定伤害类型。
{@b 1:} acid.
{@b 2:} cold.
{@b 3:} fire.
{@b Fountain of Magic.} 你获得了施放一个无伤害的咒语或法术的能力，而不需要消耗一个法术槽或使用材料组件。然而，每当你施放一个非咒语的法术时，你必须在巫师描述中的狂野魔力涌动表上滚动。掷一个D10来决定该咒语。
{@b 1-3:}以下咒语之一：{@i druidcraft}，{@i prestidigitation}，或{@i thaumaturgy}。
{@b 4-6:}以下咒语之一：{@i friends}，{@i mage hand}，或{@i message}。
{@b 7:}以下一级法术之一：{@i beast bond}，{@i longstrider}，或{@i purify food and drink}。
{@b 8:}以下二阶法术之一：{@i animal messenger}，{@i magic mouth}，或{@i skywrite}。
{@b 9: }以下三级法术之一：{@i feign death}或{@i gaseous form}。
{@b 10:} 以下四级法术之一：{@i arcane eye}或{@i locate creature}。
如果你获得了施放咒语的能力，请进行DC19宪法能力检查。如果成功，你现在知道了那个咒语（%0%）。

rows: {@b Fountain of Monster Attraction.} 你看到的下一个怪物，以及该物种的所有怪物，都会不可抗拒地被你吸引。掷一个骰子。如果是奇数，该类型的怪物认为你很美味。如果是偶数，该类型的怪物认为你绝对可爱。如果骰子掉落，你将被宣布为该物种的高级国王或其某一神灵的化身。效果消失后会发生什么，取决于你的行为和该物种的自然偏好。
{@b Fountain of Poison.}你必须做一个DC17的宪法救赎动作。拯救失败时，你会受到36（8d8）的毒药伤害，拯救成功则会受到一半的伤害。此外，如果救赎失败，你会在持续时间内中毒，或者直到用{@i lesser restoration}或类似的效果将毒药治愈。

entries: {@b Fountain of Polymorphing.} 你会在持续时间内变成别的东西。你的游戏统计数据被你所变成的生物的统计数据所取代，但你保留你的精神能力分数。掷一个D6来决定你被变成什么。
{@b 1-2:}你被多角化为不同种类的人形。在{@i reincarnation}法术的表格上滚动。你保留你所有的等级能力。
{@b 3-4:} 你会变成一个异形、龙或怪兽，其挑战等级等于或低于你的等级。你保留了你所有的等级能力，尽管根据你的新形态，你可能无法使用它们。
{@b 5-6:} 你会变成一个CR值为1或更低的野兽。你不能说话，也不能使用任何你的正常等级能力。

rows: {@b Fountain of Proficiency.} 掷一个骰子。如果是奇数，你突然变得精通（并且知道它）一个新的技能或工具组。如果是偶数，你就会失去你的一项专长。
{@b Fountain of Rearrangement.}你的属性被调换了。
{@b Fountain of Resistance.}在持续时间内，你获得对非魔法武器的击打、穿刺和切割伤害的抵抗。
{@b Fountain of Sex Change.} 你在这段时间内成为异性的一员。
{@b Fountain of Shrinking.}你缩小了，就像减少{@i enlarge/reduce}的选项一样--不过，你现在有六英寸高。掷一个骰子。如果是奇数，你的衣服和物品就会随着你缩小。如果是偶数，它们就不会。
{@b Fountain of Speech.} 掷一个骰子。如果是奇数，你会在持续时间内获得一个{@i speak with animals}法术的好处。如果是偶数，你将获得{@i speak with plants}法术的好处。如果骰子掉落，你将获得一个{@i speak with dead}法术的好处。
{@b Fountain of Static Shocks.} 你的触摸会造成电击。无论你是否愿意，你接触的任何没有接地的东西或人都会受到1d4的雷电伤害。
{@b Fountain of Teleportation.}你会被传送到一英里内随机但{@i mostly}安全的地方。
{@b Fountain of Vision Quests.} 你获得一个在你附近地区（离你不超过一天的路程）适合你等级的任务的幻象，并为完成该任务而痴迷。
{@b Fountain of Vision Changing.} 掷一个骰子。如果是奇数，你将获得10英尺以内的真实视力。如果是双数，你就会失明。

{@b Fountain of Visions.}你突然有了一个异象。掷一个骰子。如果是奇数，你看到的是一个非常强大的怪物或NPC；你可以看到它周围的环境以及它之所以如此强大的原因。如果是双数，你看到的是附近的宝藏或强大的魔法物品；你对它的价值或能力有了初步了解，但只看到守卫它的一个模糊的影子。如果骰子掉在桌上，你会获得一个极其诡异的幻象，{@i might}指向一些重要的东西（如果不是立即明显的），或者可能只是一个幻觉。
{@b Fountain of Wandering.}在持续时间内，你会失去辨别方向、距离、你的右边和左边的能力，以及辨别时间或理解指南针的能力。

{@b Fountain of Youth.} 你的年龄退步。如果你是一个年轻的成年人或青少年，你会变成一个孩子。如果你是一个成年人，你就变成一个年轻的成年人。如果你是一个成熟的成年人或老年人，你会变成一个成年人。此外，做一个DC17的宪法能力检查。如果成功，这个变化是（%1%）（至少在你正常衰老之前）。如果你失败了，并掷出1个一，做一个DC17体质检查。成功时，不会发生其他事情，但失败时，你会在持续时间内变成一个婴儿。
{@b Fountain of Random Effects.}为每个喝酒的人掷两次骰子，并将结果合并，无视进一步掷出的100。

item.name: Mantle of Mist
entries: 穿着这件斗篷时，你可以用你的行动来施展（%0%）、（%1%）或（%2%）。一旦你施放了其中一个法术，你就不能再施放该法术，直到下一个黎明。

item.name: Mantooth
entries: 当与一个施法者或具有先天施法特质的生物战斗时，你会得到一个+2的打击和伤害。此外，你也可以尝试切开任何魔法屏障，包括（%0%）、（%1%）和（%2%）。要做到这一点，你必须做一个力量检查，DC等于10+法术的等级。如果检定成功，你就摧毁了这个障碍。

item.name: Map of Illusions
entries: 这张地图具有（%0%）的所有特征。
此外，这张地图有5个电荷，在黎明时分可以重新获得1d4+1个已消耗的电荷。如果最后一次冲锋被消耗掉了，就掷一个D20。如果是1，地图就会撕裂，变得完全没有魔力。
你可以消耗一个电荷，让地图显示（作为一个脉冲的红色区域）在你的视线范围内存在幻觉或隐形的生物或物体。每次充电可持续1分钟。

item.name: Map of Magic
entries: 这张地图具有（%0%）的所有特征。
此外，这张地图有5个电荷，在黎明时分可以重新获得1d4+1个已消耗的电荷。如果最后一次冲锋被消耗掉了，就掷一个D20。如果是1，地图就会撕裂，变得完全没有魔力。
你可以消耗一个电荷，让地图显示（作为一个脉动的红色区域）你视线范围内的魔法存在，就像你施放了（%0%）。每次充电可持续1分钟。

item.name: Map of Mapping
entries: 这个卷轴在接到命令后，会开始用魔法绘制你周围地区的地图。它只记录持有地图的人可以看到的物体--隐藏的或不可见的物体不会被记录，生物也不会。可以被认为是 "风景的一部分 "的建筑--例如，被设计成普通雕像的巨兽--会被记录下来，但游荡的建筑则不会。
卷轴相当于一张11英寸×17英寸的绘图纸，每英寸有5个方格。它可以根据指令全部抹去（但不是部分）。

item.name: Marble of Cleanliness
entries: 这是一个小型的白色石头大理石。如果被扔到坚硬的物体上，它就会爆炸成一团白色的尘埃，填满30英尺的立方体并在角落里扩散。该区域被轻度遮蔽。1分钟后，灰尘消失，带走所有的灰尘、污垢、污垢和普通的、非魔法的昆虫害虫。

item.name: Mask of Attractiveness
entries: 当你戴着这个装饰性的半面罩时，你在对你感兴趣的物种和性别的人类进行魅力测试时具有优势。

item.name: Mask of Combat
entries: 这个面具上有一个伤痕累累的可怕的战士的形象。它有3个电荷。你可以用你的行动来消耗一次充电。之后的1分钟内，你在所有的攻击卷和蓄力动作上都有优势。
面具每天在黎明时分重新获得所有消耗的电荷。

item.name: Mask of Death
entries: 当你戴上这个骷髅面具时，你对所有针对凝视攻击和死亡的救赎都有优势。

items.name: Curse
entries: 这件物品被诅咒了，对它的调和使诅咒延伸到你身上。取下面具并不能结束诅咒。只要你仍然受到诅咒，你就不愿意与面具分离，并坚持每天至少戴上它一个小时。在你15英尺范围内结束其回合的生物必须做一个DC13宪法救赎动作，否则就会从你身上感染疾病。疾病的确切性质由DM决定。受害者会一直患病，直到疾病走完它的过程，它死亡，或者在它身上施放一个（%0%）。
当你被诅咒时，你会遭受并表现出一些非常轻微的疾病症状，但它永远不会在你身上发展到足以严重阻碍或伤害你。

item.name: Mask of Knowledge
entries: 这个面具包含2d4个特定类别和流派的法术，都是一级、二级或三级的法术。DM将决定这些法术。你可以对每个法术施放一次，然后在下一个黎明之前，你不能用这个面具再次施放该法术。你仍然必须提供材料组件。

item.name: Mask of Memory
entries: 这个面具没有明显的眼孔，上面装饰着100颗宝石，形成一个复杂的图案。这些宝石要么是明亮的火蛋白石，要么是略显暗淡的黑蛋白石；每种宝石的位置是随机的。当被发现时，{@i mask of memory}有25%的机会只有火蛋白石，有75%的机会有1d100颗黑蛋白石。
面具不会妨碍你的视力，戴上它后，你的暗视力可达60英尺，真视力可达10英尺，而且不会被蒙蔽。
此外，你可以用这个面具重新获得一个1到5级的任何级别的法术槽。这样做会使与法术槽等级相等的火蛋白石变成黑蛋白石。当你用完最后一颗火蛋白石后，你不能再使用面具来恢复法术槽。然而，它的其他属性依然存在。

item.name: Mask of the Wraith
entries: 这个可怕的、苍白的面具有5个电荷。在戴上它的时候，你可以用你的行动来消耗一个电荷。之后的1分钟内，你对寒冷和坏死的伤害有抵抗力，对非银色的打击、穿刺和砍击等非魔法武器的伤害也有抵抗力。此外，你不能被麻痹或中毒。
此外，你还会长出长长的、像骨头一样的爪子。你精通这些爪子。这些爪子会造成1d4+你的力量修正值的砍伤和1d8的坏死伤害，并且目标的最大命中率会被所造成的坏死伤害量所降低。如果目标是人形，它的灵魂会在1分钟后以幽灵的形式复活。幽灵不受你指挥，但不会攻击你或你的同伴，除非你先攻击。
面具每天在黄昏时重新获得1d4+1个已消耗的电荷。如果你消耗了最后的能量，请掷一个D20。如果是1，面具会出现蜘蛛网状的裂缝，并变得没有魔力。

item.name: Medallion of Defense
entries: 在你的命令下，这块珠宝会变成一个{@i shield +1}或再变回来。

item.name: Mirror of Curing
entries: 这面镜子有7个电荷。一个生物可以用它的行动来注视镜子并消耗一个电荷。然后该生物会受到{@i heal}法术的影响。
当镜子的电荷耗尽时，它就会碎裂，变得没有魔力。

item.name: Mirror of Duplication
entries: 当你注视着这面大镜子时，一个你自己的复制品就会走出来并进行攻击。它的属性、能力和装备与你完全相同。然而，它对来自非魔法武器的击打、穿刺和切割伤害有抵抗力，并且不能被魅惑、惊吓、麻痹或中毒。它的取向与你相反。
复制体将一直存在，直到它或你被杀死。如果你死了（无论是死于它的手还是因为其他原因），这个复制体就会消失，连同它第一次走出镜子时拥有的一切。

item.name: Mirror of Mental Prowess
entries: 这面大镜子有7个电荷。你可以使用你的行动来消耗两个或更多的电荷，并使用镜子来施展以下法术：{@i clairvoyance} (3电荷), {@i detect thoughts} (2电荷；仅适用于镜子中反射的目标), {@i  plane shift} (5电荷), 或{@i scrying} (5电荷)
镜子每天在黎明时分重新获得1d6+1次充电。

item.name: Mirror of Reflecting
entries: 这面大镜子可以显示出任何被反射的东西的真实面貌。变形的生物或用魔法伪装的生物会以其真实的形式反映出来。幻觉缺乏反射，无形的生物也能在其中看到。
奇怪的是，吸血鬼在这面镜子中也有反射。

item.name: Mirror of Retention
entries: 当你说出命令词时，这面镜子将记录下未来24小时内发生在它前面的所有事件。你可以通过再次说出命令词来播放图像。图像是实时播放的，但你可以旋转镜子，使其加速、倒退、放慢或暂停。第三次说命令词会删除整个一天的记录（没有办法只删除部分记录），让它随时可以再次使用。

item.name: Mirror of Sending
entries: 这面镜子是3英尺乘5英尺，有50个电荷。你可以专注于任何你熟悉的、去过的地方。那个地方的图像会出现在镜子里。然后你可以消耗一个电荷，让一个无生命的物体穿过镜子，进入正在显示的地方。该物体必须能够装入镜子的框架。
一旦50个电荷全部用完，镜子就会碎裂，变得没有魔力。

item.name: Mirror of Truth
entries: 根据命令，这面镜子会在里面出现一张可怕的脸。你可以问它一个问题。镜子会如实回答这个问题，只要正确的答案可以在它周围500英里内的生物的脑海中读到。
一旦你使用了这面镜子，你就不能再使用它，直到下一个黎明。

item.name: Mirror of Vanity
entries: 观察这面镜子的生物必须做一个DC15的智慧题，否则就会被镜子迷住。在被魅惑时，该生物会失去能力，只能欣赏自己的镜像。
如果该生物受到伤害或视线被打断，它可以做一个新的蓄力动作，如果成功则结束该效果。之后，该生物将不知道已经过去了多少时间。

item.name: Mixing Spoon
entries: 你可以用这个勺子将两种药水混合在一起。然后，在饮用时，两种药水都能完美地发挥作用，你不需要在药水混溶表中进行滚动。

item.name: Monster Mask
entries: 这个木制面具被雕刻成脸部巨人、人形或具有人类脸部的怪兽的形状，例如半人马、尾兽或美杜莎。面具上所描绘的生物将是大尺寸或更小。
戴上这个面具时，你可以{@i shapechange}变成那个生物，时间长达1小时。你不需要集中精力来维持这个形状。
一旦你使用这个能力，你就不能再使用它，直到下一个黄昏。

item.name: Mouse Chariot
entries: 这是一辆微型战车。如果你把一对老鼠拴在上面，并说出命令，战车就会放大，老鼠就会变成马。在马的形态下，小鼠的行为就像被训练成拉战车的正常驯养的马一样。
{@i mouse chariot}有24个电荷。它在放大的状态下每花一小时或部分时间就会消耗一个电荷。当它有电荷时，你可以随心所欲地使用它。当它的能量耗尽时，马匹会变回小鼠；一回合后，战车会恢复到微型形态。
战车每天在黎明时分重新获得1d6个已消耗的电荷。

item.name: Mug of Plenty
entries: 这个大盖子的钢杯有5个电荷。当你说出命令词并消耗一个电荷时，这个杯子就会装满你选择的一种无魔法、无毒、无伤害的饮料。
每天黎明时分，杯子会重新获得1d4+1次充电。

item.name: Muzzle of Lycanthropic Control
entries: 如果这个口罩被固定在任何处于野兽形态的狼人的嘴上，它会迫使狼人保持野兽形态，直到它被移除。如果狼人是混合形态，它会迫使它变成野兽形态。枪口被魔法锁住，并将保持这种状态，直到说出命令语或对其施放{@i knock}的咒语。
当戴上口罩时，狼人不能说话，不能使用它的咬合攻击，也不能变身，而且它的速度会降低10英尺。

item.name: Nail of Building
entries: 这颗钉子必须作为第一颗钉子敲入一个完全的木质结构；这个结构必须适合在一个100英尺的立方体内。后来，当建筑完成后，这枚钉子必须被移除。这将导致整个结构和它的所有内容（只有无生命的、非生物的物体）进入钉子内的一个超维空间。
你可以在任何时候将钉子钉入地下，并说出命令语。建筑物就会重新出现，钉子就会失去魔力。
由于这个东西采用了超维空间，把它放在一个{@i bag of holding}或类似的物体里会导致两个物品都被摧毁，并且打开一个通往星界的裂缝。

item.name: Necklace of Mystic Eidolons
entries: 这条项链上挂有1d8+1个金字塔形的珠子。你可以使用一个动作来分离一个珠子，同时想象你曾经去过的距离你当前位置100英里以内的地方。当珠子落地时，一个你的虚幻影像就会出现在那个地方。这个影像的功能与{@i project image}法术创造的影像相同，只是它的持续时间不超过1小时。
此外，你可以通过该图像施法，就像你站在它的位置一样。一旦你这样做，该图像就会消失。

item.name: Necklace of Protection from Charm
entries: This necklace has a large gemstone hanging from it. While wearing the necklace, you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

item.name: Necklace of Strangulation
entries: This appears to be a helpful necklace, such as a {@i necklace of adaptation}. However, as soon as you put this necklace on, it will grab on to your neck and begin strangling you. You will begin to suffocate unless the necklace can be ripped off. This requires a DC 25 Strength ability check. The necklace can also be cut; its armor class is 18, it has 30 hit points, and immune to poison and psychic damage. In addition, the necklace takes only have the damage dealt to it, and you take the other half. A {@i remove curse} will cause the necklace to instantly fall off.
The {@i necklace of strangulation} will remain clamped around your neck until you are nothing but a skeleton; only then will it fall off on its own.

item.name: Needle of Lively Tattoos
entries: This needle produces tattoos that move on their own, as if they had been created by the {@i minor illusion} spell. The actual quality of the tattoo depends on the abilities of the tattoo artist.

item.name: Needle of Repair
entries: If you touch this needle to any nonmagical cloth, leather, or metallic item, you can use the needle to cast either {@i mending} or the Cleaning variant of {@i prestidigitation} on it.

item.name: Net of Plenty
entries: This net attracts fish and gives you advantage on Intelligence (Survival) rolls to catch fish with it.

item.name: Net of Spirit Snaring
entries: This net can be used to restrain creatures that are normally immune to being restrained, including ghosts and other incorporeal undead as well as air elementals and other such creatures. If used to restrain an undead, that creature has disadvantage on rolls made to escape it.

item.name: Noisome Spirit Chaser
entries: These firecrackers usually come in sets of 1d4+1. If one is lit, it explodes 1 round later in a cloud of foul-smelling (but not dangerous) smoke, which quickly dissipates. All ephemeral, ethereal, or incorporeal fey, fiends, and undead must make a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of you for 1 minute. While frightened, the creature must use the Dash action to move as fast as possible away from the {@i noisome spirit chaser}.

item.name: Obedient Hourglass
entries: While the sand in this hourglass normally falls from the top bulb to the bottom bulb in exactly one hour, you may command it to act as a timer and set it to time as little as ten seconds and as long as ten days.

item.name: Oil of Agelessness
entries: As an action, this oil can be applied to the skin of a living creature, it causes that creature to stop aging for 1 year.

item.name: Oil of Animation
entries: As an action, you can sprinkle this oil over a Medium or smaller plant or inanimate object, which turns it into an awakened plant or animated object. The oil lasts for 1 hour, then the plant or object becomes a normal, inanimate thing again. During this time, the plant or object is charmed by you and follows your orders.

item.name: Oil of Armor, Type Ⅰ
entries: As an action, this oil can be applied to your skin. As long as you aren't wearing any armor, your natural AC is improved for 10 minutes. The {@i oil of armor} doesn't count as armor, so it can be used in conjunction with spells such as {@i mage armor} or abilities such as a monk's Unarmored Defense.
Your natural armor class improves to 12.

item.name: Oil of Armor, Type Ⅱ
entries: As an action, this oil can be applied to your skin. As long as you aren't wearing any armor, your natural AC is improved for 10 minutes. The {@i oil of armor} doesn't count as armor, so it can be used in conjunction with spells such as {@i mage armor} or abilities such as a monk's Unarmored Defense.
Your natural armor class improves to 14.

item.name: Oil of Armor, Type Ⅲ
entries: As an action, this oil can be applied to your skin. As long as you aren't wearing any armor, your natural AC is improved for 10 minutes. The {@i oil of armor} doesn't count as armor, so it can be used in conjunction with spells such as {@i mage armor} or abilities such as a monk's Unarmored Defense.
Your natural armor class improves to 16

item.name: Oil of Beauty
entries: As an action, you can apply a dose of this oil to your skin. A vial usually contains 1d4+2 doses. You become far more attractive than you normally are, and have advantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks for 1d4 hours.

item.name: Oil of Buoyancy
entries: As an action, you can apply a dose of this oil to your skin. A vial usually contains 1d4+2 doses. For 8 hours after, you won't sink in water normally. If someone is attempting to pull you under, you have advantage on Strength checks to resist.

item.name: Oil of Cloaking
entries: As an action, you can apply a dose of this oil to a magical item. A vial usually contains 1d4+2 doses. For the next 24 hours, the item won't be detected as magical, as if you had cast the False Aura version of the {@i Nystul's mystic aura} spell on it. In addition, if the item was such that it would normally be detected by the {@i detect evil and good} spell, it won't be.

item.name: Oil of Disenchantment
entries: As an action, this oil can be applied to your skin. Doing so removes one of the following: a curse, lycanthropy, mummy rot, possession, or the charmed condition.

item.name: Oil of Elasticity
entries: As an action, you can apply a dose of this oil to your skin. A vial usually contains 1d3 doses. For 1 hour afterwards, you become incredibly flexible. You can move through any opening large enough for a creature one size category smaller than you, your reach increases by 5 feet, you have advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) rolls, and you can bend your joints in any direction.

item.name: Oil of Eternal Fire
entries: If used to fill a lamp, a pint of this oil will burn constantly for 1 week. Outside of a lamp, however, the oil is non-flammable and non-explosive. A container usually contains 1d4+2 pints of oil.

item.name: Oil of Feather Falling
entries: As an action, this oil can be applied to the skin. For the next 1d4 hours, you will take no damage from falling.

item.name: Oil of Fumbling
entries: This appears to {@i oil of resistance} (q.v.) or a similar useful oil. However, when under stress in combat, it turns into an incredibly slippery substance, similar to {@i oil of slipperiness}. Each round, you must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw to avoid dropping whatever you are holding. If you fail your roll by 5 or more, you also fall prone.
The oil lasts for 8 hours, but can be washed off by applying copious amounts of alcohol, by using a {@i dispel magic} or {@i remove curse}, or by applying {@i universal solvent}.

item.name: Oil of Immovability
entries: A vial of this usually contains 1d4 doses. As an action, a dose can be applied to the hinges of a door or chest lid, the gears of a machine, the axel of a wagon, or to the moving parts of another object. For the next 8 hours, those moving parts are locked in place. It requires a DC 25 Strength ability check to move the parts, but that usually causes the object to break first, unless it is a very sturdy object.

item.name: Oil of Metal Fatigue
entries: This appears to {@i oil of sharpness} or a similar useful oil. If a dose is applied to any nonmagical metal, it rusts the metal in 1 minute. Weapons take a permanent -1 penalty to damage rolls, and armor takes a permanent -1 penalty to the AC it offers.
However, if this oil is thrown on an iron- or steel-based creature, such as a gorgon or many construct, it inflicts 9 (2d8) fire damage to that creature.

item.name: Oil of Neutral Scent
entries: As an action, you can apply a dose of this oil to your skin. A vial usually contains 1d4+2 doses. For 1 hour afterwards, this oil completely removes your scent, and you can't be tracked by smell.

item.name: Oil of Resistance
entries: As an action, you can apply this oil to your skin. For 1 hour afterwards, you have resistance to one type of damage. Roll a d8 to determine the damage type.

item.name: Oil of Rust-Proofing
entries: As an action, you can apply a dose of this oil to a metallic object, such as a weapon or armor. A vial usually contains 1d4 doses. For 8 hours afterwards, the object won't suffer from the effects of rust, even if it was caused by rust monsters or {@i oil of metal fatigue} (q.v.).

item.name: Oil of Scribes
entries: As an action, you can brush a dose of this oil on written text. A vial usually contains 1d4+2 doses. The oil will translate the words to a language you can read. It won't harm the surface on which it was brushed, and will dry up in 1 hour, causing the words to return to their original language.

item.name: Oil of Scrying
entries: If you can pour a dose of this oil into a bowl of water and then spend a minute studying the silvery swirls it produces, you can use the oil to cast {@i scrying}. A vial usually contains 1d3 doses.

item.name: Oil of Stone Passage
entries: As an action, a dose of this oil can be applied to a section of solid stone. This opens a passage in that stone, as if {@i passwall} had been cast on it. The passage lasts for 1 hour, then the stone returns to normal.

item.name: Oil of the Dryad
entries: As an action, this oil can be applied to your skin. For 1 hour afterwards, you may move through trees as if {@i tree stride} had been cast on you.

item.name: Oil of the Pickpocket
entries: As an action, you can apply a dose of this oil to your hands. A vial usually contains 1d4+2 doses. For 10 minutes afterwards, you have advantage on Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) checks.

item.name: Oil of Timelessness
entries: As an action, one or more doses of this oil can be applied to an inanimate object. A vial usually contains 1d4+2 doses, and you need one dose to coat a Medium or smaller object, two doses for a Large object, four for a Huge object, and eight for a Gargantuan object. The object will then age at a rate of only 1 day for every year that passes. The oil protects the object from the ravages of time and normal weathering, not from deliberate or magical damage.

item.name: Oil of Unlocking
entries: As an action, you can pour a dose of this oil into the keyhole of any lock. That lock will then be unlocked. This doesn't work on magical locks or on doors protected by {@i arcane lock.} A vial usually contains 1d4 doses.

item.name: Oil of Vision, Type Ⅰ
entries: As an action, you can apply a drop of this oil in an eye; it takes two actions to place a drop in both eyes. A vial usually contains 2d4 drops. If you only place the oil on one eye, you will be dizzy and at disadvantage on all Dexterity ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws that employ vision until the oil wears off in 1 hour or you put a drop in the other eye.
When placed in your eyes, you gain darkvision to 60 feet for 1 hour. If you already have darkvision, its range increases by 30 feet.

item.name: Oil of Vision, Type Ⅱ
entries: As an action, you can apply a drop of this oil in an eye; it takes two actions to place a drop in both eyes. A vial usually contains 2d4 drops. If you only place the oil on one eye, you will be dizzy and at disadvantage on all Dexterity ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws that employ vision until the oil wears off in 1 hour or you put a drop in the other eye.
When placed in your eyes, you gain truesight to 30 feet for 1 hour.

item.name: Ointment of Flying
entries: This small crystal jar is filled with 1d4+1 doses of a thick mixture that smells like ozone. The jar and its contents weigh 1/2 pound.
As an action, one dose of the ointment can be applied to the skin. For the next hour, you gain the benefits of the {@i fly} spell.

item.name: Ointment of Healing, Type Ⅰ
entries: This small ceramic jar is filled with 1d4+4 doses of a viscous, grainy mixture that smells like cut herbs. As an action, one dose of this ointment can be applied to your skin. You regain 3d6 hit points.

item.name: Ointment of Healing, Type Ⅱ
entries: This small ceramic jar is filled with 1d4+4 doses of a viscous, grainy mixture that smells like cut herbs. As an action, one dose of this ointment can be applied to your skin. You regain 70 hit points and lose the blindness, deafness, paralyzed, and poisoned conditions.

item.name: Ointment of Poison
entries: This small clay jar is filled with 1d4+1 doses of a thick mixture that smells like incense. The jar and its content weigh 1/2 pound.

This appears to be {@i ointment of healing}. As an action, one dose of the ointment can be applied to the skin. You must then make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 8d10 poison damage on a failed saving throw or half as much on a successful one.

item.name: Orrery of the Planes
entries: This complex mechanical device shows the relative positions of the various planes in relation to the prime. If a very powerful, plane-shaking event occurs on one of those planes, the sphere used to denote that plane will alter in appearance to reflect that event.

item.name: Parchment of Monster Holding
entries: While holding this item, you may cast a spell of 5th level or lower that allows you to conjure or summon creatures, such as {@i conjure animals} or {@i summon lesser demons}. Instead of the creature or creatures appearing as they normally would, an image of the creature appears on the parchment instead. An intelligent creature (Intelligence of 4 or higher) may make a DC 17 Charisma saving throw to resist.

At a later time, you or someone else may place the parchment on the ground and speak the command word. The creature is then released from the parchment and acts as if you had just cast the spell that summoned it. The parchment is then destroyed.

item.name: Parchment of Spell Stealing
entries: This parchment is found in sheaves of 1d4+2. You become attuned to the entire sheaf of parchment at a time. If you hold this parchment up within 10 feet of a creature casting a spell from the wizard's spell list (regardless of if the caster is a wizard or not), then that creature must make an Intelligence saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failure, some of the spell's energies are sucked into the parchment and the spell's formula appears on the parchment. You can use then use the parchment to copy the spell into your spellbook (requiring the normal amount of time and gold) or use it as a spell scroll. After 7 days, or when you copy the spell or use it as a scroll, the {@i parchment of spell stealing} crumbles into ash.

Regardless of the original spell's target, the remaining energy that wasn't trapped in the parchment affects you. Regardless of the type of spell that was cast, you must make a Constitution saving throw, using the original caster's spell save DC. You take 3 (1d6) force damage per spell slot level used to cast it on a failed saving throw, or no damage on a successful one.

If the original caster made its initial Intelligence saving throw, the spell wasn't on the wizard's spell list, or if the spell was cast through a scroll or magical item, the parchment then turns to ash without catching the spell's energy or formula.

item.name: Pearl of Entrancement
entries: If you place this pearl in the mouth of a sleeping or unconscious humanoid, it will remain asleep for 30 days. During this time, it can't be woken up unless the pearl is removed, and will not need food, water, or air. If the pearl is removed before the 30 days are over, it can be reused; otherwise, it dissolves in the target's mouth.

You may also, once each day, use the pearl to cast {@i dominate person} on that creature, with a duration of 1 hour. The creature will follow your orders, but will appear to others to be sleepwalking or, at best, walking around in a daze.

You may also use the {@i pearl of entrancement} as the material component for the Hedged Prison or Slumber variant of the {@i imprisonment} spell, in place of the normal jade miniature or soporific herbs. The pearl isn't consumed in the casting, and the target makes its saving throw at disadvantage.

item.name: Pearl of Flying
entries: While holding this in one hand, you can fly at a speed of twice your walking move. You can fly for up to 8 hours, then must take a long rest before you can fly again. If you drop the pearl, you will immediately fall.

item.name: Pearl of the Tides
entries: These are large, iridescent pearls. If you hold the pearl in the palm of your hand and concentrate, you can affect the tide, and you continue affecting it for as long as you concentrate, and once you have used the pearl, you can't use it again until the following dawn or dusk—each pearl can be used twice per day. While there are two distinct types of {@i pearls of the tides}, they are often found in pairs, one of each type.

items.name: Pearl of the Ebbing Tides
entries: You can make all water within 120 feet of you recede at the rate of 5 feet each round. Once you stop concentrating, the water instantly rushes back.

items.name: Pearl of the Rising Tides
entries: You can make all water within 120 feet of you rise at the rate of 5 feet each round. Once you stop concentrating, the water instantly recedes.

item.name: Periapt of Proof Against Sound
entries: This delicate silver chain has a triangle-cut chunk of smoky quartz attached to it. While you wear it, you are immune to thunder damage and to being deafened.

item.name: Philter of Glibness
entries: After drinking this philter, you gain a +10 to all Deception, Intimidation, and Persuasion skill checks for 1 hour. You also automatically succeed on your saving throw if you are in a {@i zone of truth}, but the {@i zone's} caster will believe that you failed.

item.name: Philter of Stammering and Stuttering
entries: This appears to be a {@i philter of glibness}. An {@i identify} spell will reveal its true nature. If you drink it, you lose the ability to speak coherently for 1 hour. You can't cast any spell with a verbal component unless you first succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, as if you were making a concentration check. In addition, you have disadvantage on Charisma skill checks that involve speech.

item.name: Pick of Proficiency
entries: This is an ivory pick used by musicians to strum instruments. When using the pick, you have proficiency in the Charisma (Performance) skill and proficiency in all stringed musical instruments. If you already have proficiency in Performance and in stringed instruments, you may use twice your proficiency bonus when making skill checks.

item.name: Pin of Communication
entries: These pins come in pairs. When two creatures with different languages wear the pins, they can understand each other as if the {@i tongues} spell had been cast on them. This effect remains as long as they are both wearing the pins.

item.name: Pipes of Animal Calls
entries: You must be proficient with wind instruments or with the Animal Handling or Nature skill to use these pipes.

If you picture an animal while blowing through this redwood recorder, you will produce perfect simulations of the sounds that animal makes. You can't speak to animals using this pipe, but you can accurately reproduce warning calls, distress calls, mating calls, and so forth.

item.name: Pipes of Pain
entries: You must be proficient with wind instruments to use these pipes. This ebony flute has 3 charges and regains 1d3 expended charges each day at dusk.

If you use your action to play these pipes and expend a charge, the pipe emits a painful, shrill fluting noise. Any number of creatures you choose that you can see within 30 feet of you must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 2 (1d4) psychic damage at the start of each of its turns and is stunned until the beginning of its next turn due to the incredible pain the pipe's shrill notes caused. You may continue playing for as long as you want, up to 10 minutes at a time.

A creature reduced to 0 hit points by these pipes makes its death saving throws (if applicable) at advantage. If the creature succeeds on these saving throws and becomes stable, it regains 1 hit point.

item.name: Pipes of Sounding
entries: You must be proficient with wind instruments to use these pipes. You can use your action to blow through the pipes and have them produce any sound you wish, other than understandable speech. Possible sounds include blowing wind, bird calls, footsteps, screams, and mumbled, unintelligible speech. The sounds continue as long as you wish to play, and you may switch the type of sounds the pipes produce as a bonus action. You can also make the sounds appear to originate in any location within 60 feet of you. You can't use these pipes to create sounds loud enough to inflict damage.

A creature may use its action to listen critically to the sound you're producing and succeed on an Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the sound is false. The DC is 8 + the better of your Deception or Performance skills.

item.name: Pipes of the Sewers (Variant)
entries: This is a variant on the {@item pipes of the sewers} presented in the {@i Dungeon Master's Guide}.

These pipes summon one {@creature swarm of bats|mm} per charge spent, ordinary bats and giant bats are indifferent towards you, and you can attempt to take control of a swarm of bats that is under someone else's control. It is otherwise identical to the original version.

item.name: Platter of Purity
entries: This is a silver or golden serving tray, 1 foot wide and 2 feet long. Any food placed on the tray for 1 minute or longer is purified of all nonmagical poisons and contaminants.

item.name: Poisonsword
entries: This sword is made from razor-sharp iron-colored crystal, and poison constantly oozes out from minute cracks in it. On a successful hit, it inflicts an addition 7 (2d6) poison damage, and the target must make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute.

item.name: Portable Bridge
entries: This rough gray cloth folds to the dimensions of handkerchief. It unfolds into a magical bridge that requires no pillars or cables, is strong as stone, and can take a load of many thousands of pounds without collapsing.

You can use your action to unfold the {@i portable bridge} on one side of a gap or chasm. The bridge will extend up to 100 feet to the other side. If it can't reach the other side, it folds back up into cloth. You can use your action to take hold of the edges of the cloth and fold it back up.

item.name: Portable Spring
entries: This shimmering, silvery-blue cloth is folded up to the dimensions of a handkerchief. It unfolds into a circular well 3 feet in diameter. It produces 100 gallons of clear, fresh water each day. You can use your action to take hold of the edges of the cloth and fold it back up.

item.name: Potion of Agility
entries: When you drink this potion, your Dexterity increases to 19 for 1 hour. This potion is green, with silvery streaks that constantly swirl around inside.

item.name: Potion of Blindness
entries: This potion looks, smells, and tastes like a {@i potion of healing} or other beneficial potion. An {@i identify} spell will reveal its true nature. When you drink this potion, you are blinded for 1d4 hours or until you are subjected to a {@i lesser restoration} or similar spell. This potion looks, smells, and tastes like a {@i potion of clairvoyance} or other beneficial potion. An {@i identify} spell reveals its true nature.

item.name: Potion of Childishness
entries: This potion looks, smells, and tastes like a {@i potion of longevity} or other beneficial potion. An {@i identify} spell will reveal its true nature. When you drink this potion, you regress in age to early childhood (five years old for a human).

Your Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma remain the same, and you retain all of your class abilities. However, your Strength is halved (to a minimum score of 4), and your Dexterity and Constitution are each reduced by 1d4+1 (minimum of one-half your original score), and you become one size category smaller (minimum of Tiny). Your clothing and equipment don't change with you. In addition, you gain a new flaw: {@i I'm a child now, and I sometimes act like it—especially if I really want something or I don't get my way}.

This is technically not a curse, and {@i remove curse} won't restore you to your original age. A {@i greater restoration} will, but only if cast within 24 hours. Otherwise, the effects are permanent (although you will continue to age at a normal rate) unless a {@i wish} is used to restore you.

item.name: Potion of Confusion
entries: This potion looks, smells, and tastes like a {@i potion of mind reading} or other beneficial potion. An {@i identify} spell reveals its true nature. Upon drinking it, you are subjected to the {@i confusion} spell for 10 minutes.

item.name: Potion of Corrosive Touch
entries: After drinking this potion, your hands begin sweating acid for 10 minutes, whether you want them to or not. Any creature or object made of wood or leather that you touch takes 7 (2d6) acid damage. This potion is unhealthy yellow color that constantly seethes and boils, although it's cool to the touch.

item.name: Potion of Craftsmanship
entries: For 8 hours after drinking this potion, you may use twice your proficiency bonus when using any artisan tools. This potion has bands of steel-gray and wood-brown that quickly separate back into bands after being shaken.

item.name: Potion of Creation
entries: If consumed, this potion does nothing but make you feel nauseated for 1 round. On the potion's bottle, there is a label with a picture of a common inanimate object: a piece of furniture, a shield, a ladder, a wheelbarrow, a common weapon, and so on. If the potion is poured onto the ground, the liquid will congeal and become the object on the label. This transformation is permanent, although a {@i dispel magic} will turn the object into useless goo. The potion's vial looks as though it is filled with sawdust but sounds as if it were filled with a liquid.

item.name: Potion of Curing Lycanthropy
entries: If you are an infected lycanthrope and you drink this potion, you are immediately drop to 0 hit point and must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. If you succeed, you are cured of lycanthropy. While you must make death saving throws, you do so at advantage. If you fail, you aren't cured and are restored to 1 hit point. The potion is murky green and has a sprig of wolfsbane in it.

item.name: Potion of Deafness
entries: This potion looks, smells, and tastes like a {@i potion of healing} or other beneficial potion. An {@i identify} spell will reveal its true nature. When you drink this potion, you are deafened for 1d4 hours or until you are subjected to a {@i lesser restoration} or similar spell. This potion looks, smells, and tastes like a {@i potion of clairvoyance} or other beneficial potion. An {@i identify} spell reveals its true nature.

item.name: Potion of Defense, Type Ⅰ
entries: When you drink this potion, your AC improves by +1 for 1 hour. This potion looks steely-gray and is rather granular.

item.name: Potion of Defense, Type Ⅱ
entries: When you drink this potion, your AC improves by +2 for 1 hour. This potion looks steely-gray and is rather granular.

item.name: Potion of Defense, Type Ⅲ
entries: When you drink this potion, your AC improves by +3 for 1 hour. This potion looks steely-gray and is rather granular.

item.name: Potion of Dreaming
entries: While you drink this potion, you must concentrate on a person, object, or place, and then you must immediately go to bed. While you sleep, you will have a dream about that thing and learn one completely true thing about it that you didn't already know. The detail will be couched in dream-imagery and might not be easily understood, however.

item.name: Potion of False Visions
entries: This potion looks, smells, and tastes like a {@i potion of forewarning} (q.v.) or other beneficial potion. An {@i identify} spell reveals its true nature. Upon drinking it, you fall into a trance for 1 minute, during which time you get a false vision of the future. Although the nature of the vision varies, it usually involves you or an ally or loved one enjoying a great triumph or terrible misfortune.

item.name: Potion of Forewarning
entries: When you drink this potion, you go into a trance for 1 minute, during which time you gain a vision of the future. The vision is often heavily symbolized but is always true. This vial seems to be filled with swirling clouds that subtly change color, and shapes appear to constantly form and dissolve.

item.name: Potion of Forgetfulness
entries: This potion looks, smells, and tastes like a {@i potion of mind reading} or other beneficial potion. An {@i identify} spell reveals its true nature. Drinking it causes you to forget everything that has happened to you in the last 24 hours.

item.name: Potion of Fright
entries: This potion looks, smells, and tastes like a {@i potion of healing} or other beneficial potion. An {@i identify} spell will reveal its true nature. Drinking it curses you for 10 minutes. While you are cursed, you are frightened of random creatures and things that are within 10 feet of you.

item.name: Potion of Gray Slumber
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain the effects of the {@i feign death} spell for 1 hour. This potion is an opaque gray with shadowy {@i things} floating in it.

item.name: Potion of Greater Restoration
entries: This potion is blue with a white bead in it; the bead continually pulses, like a heart.
When you drink it, you gain the effects of a {@i greater restoration} spell.

item.name: Potion of Insomnia
entries: When you drink this potion, you are immune to being rendered unconscious through any means for 8 hours. You also can't take any long rests during this time. This potion is bright yellow-green and bubbly.

item.name: Potion of Lesser Restoration
entries: This potion is blue with a white bead in it; the bead continually pulses, like a heart.
When you drink it, you gain the effects of a {@i lesser restoration} spell.

item.name: Potion of Lethargy
entries: This potion looks, smells, and tastes like a {@i potion of speed} or other beneficial potion. An {@i identify} spell reveals its true nature. When you drink this potion, you are under the effects of the {@i slow} spell for 1 hour.

item.name: Potion of Lycanthropy
entries: This potion looks, smells, and tastes like a {@i potion of healing} or other beneficial potion, and when you drink it, you heal 2d4 hit points. An {@i identify} spell will reveal its true nature: on the next full moon, you will turn into a lycanthrope. The DM will choose a lycanthrope or roll on the table to determine the type.

item.name: Potion of Magic Resistance
entries: When you drink this potion, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects for 10 minutes afterwards. This potion looks like liquid lead.

item.name: Potion of Mind Restoration
entries: This potion cures any type of insanity or confusion, restores memories that have been altered or removed with the {@i modify memory} or similar spell, ends the charmed condition, and reverses the effects of the {@i feeblemind} spell. This potion is a clear purple that sparkles when you shake it.

item.name: Potion of Monsters
entries: If consumed, this potion does nothing but make you feel nauseated for 1 round. On the potion's bottle, there is a picture of a hobgoblin. If you pour this potion out on the ground, it congeals into several hobgoblins, who immediately attack. If slain or subjected to a {@i dispel magic} spell, they and their equipment dissolve into goo. This potion is rainbow-colored and smells musty.
Roll a d6 on the following table to determine what type of hobgoblins appear.

rows: Three {@creature hobgoblin|mm|hobgoblins} and one {@creature hobgoblin captain|mm}
three {@creature hobgoblin captain|mm|hobgoblin captains} and one {@creature hobgoblin warlord|mm}

item.name: Potion of Nutrition
entries: When you drink this potion, you can go for 1 week without eating or drinking. This potion looks like very thin, watery oatmeal.

item.name: Potion of Perception
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain advantage on all Wisdom (Perception) checks, and your passive Perception increases by +5. This clear potion has an eyeball bobbing in it, which vanishes when the potion is opened.

item.name: Potion of Petrifaction
entries: This potion looks, smells, and tastes like a {@i potion of invulnerability} or other beneficial potion. An {@i identify} spell reveals its true nature. When you drink this potion, you must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be instantly turned to stone. This condition lasts until magically reversed with a {@i dispel magic} cast with a 6th-level or higher spell slot.

item.name: Potion of Plant Growth
entries: If you spend your action to sprinkle this potion over a 10-foot-square patch of vegetation, that area is under the effect of a {@i plant growth} spell.

item.name: Potion of Pursuit
entries: When you drink this potion, your walking speed doubles, and you can take the Dash option as a bonus action. This potion is bright purple, with lighter purple swirls that zip around the liquid.

item.name: Potion of Rainbow Hues
entries: When you drink this potion, you can use a bonus action to change the coloration of you and everything you are wearing. You may even turn several different colors and any pattern you can think of. If you wish, you can have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) skill checks while the potion is in effect. The potion lasts for 1d4 hours. Inside the vial, the liquid slowly changes from one color to another.

item.name: Potion of Recall
entries: When you drink this potion, you will remember everything that you do or experience for the next 1 hour in perfect clarity. This potion is crystal clear but fills with golden sparks when shaken or poured.

item.name: Potion of Rest
entries: When you drink this potion, you lose 1 level of exhaustion. This potion is brown and bubbly.
You can only benefit from one such potion, and then can't benefit from another until you have taken a long rest.

item.name: Potion of Shadow Form
entries: When you drink this potion, you and everything you are carrying turn into a shadow for 1 hour. This potion's container seems to hold a black fog that moves and pours like water.

In this form, you are immune to being grappled and restrained, and to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons, but you are vulnerable to radiant damage. You can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing. When you're in dim light or darkness, you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) skill rolls and can take the Hide action as a bonus action. Finally, you gain darkvision to 60 feet, if you didn't have it already.

However, you can't manipulate objects and can't attack anyone except for other creatures made of shadows, including other creatures who have consumed this potion, creatures such as {@creature shadow|mm|shadows} or {@creature shadow demon|mm|shadow demons}, and creatures native to the Shadowfell.

item.name: Potion of Sleeping
entries: When you drink this potion, you instantly fall into a peaceful sleep for 1 hour; the potion only works on willing creatures, however. When you wake up, you gain the benefits for a long rest. The creature will be awoken early if it takes damage or someone uses an action to shake or slap it awake. In that case, the creature won't gain the benefits of this potion. You can only benefit from this potion once, and then can't benefit from another {@i potion of sleeping} until you take a long rest. This potion is a soft, restful blue color.

item.name: Potion of Sobriety
entries: When you drink this potion, you sober up instantly and without a hangover, no matter how drunk you were or whether you became drunk through mundane or magical means.

item.name: Potion of Spirit-Binding
entries: When you use your action to splash this potion on any creature with the Amorphous, Ephemeral, Ethereal Jaunt, or Incorporeal Movement trait, that creature solidifies for 10 minutes. It loses any damage resistances it had during this time, and any damage immunities it had become damage resistances. In addition, it loses immunity to the grappled and restrained conditions.
This potion looks like ether but makes a solid, clunking noise when the vial is shaken.

item.name: Potion of Tongues
entries: When you drink this potion, you gain the effects of the {@i tongues} spell for 1 hour. This potion is a warm purple color and has a tongue floating in it, which vanishes when you open the potion.

item.name: Potion of Truth
entries: When you drink a potion, you must make a DC 15 Charisma ability check each time you want to tell a lie for the next 1d4 hours. This potion is a light gold in color and filled with bubbles that constantly form and pop; the bubbles look like little eyes.

item.name: Potion of Useful Appendages
entries: When you drink this potion, you immediately grow new appendages, which last for 1d4 hours before withering and falling off. The appendage passes through clothing and armor as if they weren't there. The DM should roll on or pick from the following table. This potion is bone-white with streaks of pale green, and shaking the potion fails to mix the colors.
Roll a d6 on the following table to determine the appendage that is grown.

rows: Can hold onto objects but can't wield weapons; can slap for 1 bludgeoning damage
Two extra arms, under your current arms
Can hold onto objects; you gain one additional melee or ranged weapon attack for the duration
Two crab claws, under your current arms

You gain one additional melee weapon attack. You have proficiency with this attack and inflict 3 (1d4) bludgeoning damage plus your Strength modifier, and the target is grappled (escape DC equal to 8 + your Strength modifier + your proficiency bonus).
Can hold onto objects but can't wield weapons; can slap for 1 bludgeoning damage, and on a hit, the target is grappled (escape DC equal to 8 + your Strength modifier + your proficiency bonus).
As per two tentacles, but grappled target has disadvantage when attempting to escape.

item.name: Potion of Venom
entries: When you drink this potion, you grow a pair of long fangs for 10 minutes. You are proficient in biting with these fangs. If you bite a living creature, that creature takes 1d4 piercing damage and 2d8 poison damage, and must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. In addition, while the potion is in effect, you are immune to poison damage and the poisoned condition. This potion is an unpleasant bile-yellow color, and it constantly burbles.

item.name: Prism of Distraction
entries: This scintillating prism has 3 charges. If you hold the prism up to a source of bright light, you may use your action to expend a charge and cast {@i hypnotic pattern}.

item.name: Purposed Sword
entries: You gain +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

Purposed swords are similar to {@item Arrow of Slaying|dmg|Arrows of Slaying} and {@item Arrow of Harm|EnMa|Arrows of Harm}. The most well known example of a purposed sword is a sword of dragon-slaying, but these swords can be made to slay any sort of creature.
This sword inflicts an extra die of damage to creatures of the type to which it is purposed (i.e. a shortsword of giant slaying inflicts 2d6 damage to a giant).

entries.name: Base items
entries: 这个物品变体可以应用于以下基本物品。

item.name: Quaal's Feather Token, Arbor
entries: You can use your action to grind the token underfoot. You and everything you are carrying then polymorphs into a Large tree. This lasts for 7d12 days, during which you fall into a dream-like state. While in this form, don't need to eat, breathe, or drink—or rather, you gain your nutrients via sunlight and water, like a normal tree. At the end of that time, you will awaken in your true form.
If, while in tree form, you are damaged to the point of destruction (such as being felled by loggers), you will return to your true form with 1 hit point.

item.name: Quaal's Feather Token, Binding
entries: When placed on a door, this token adheres to it and locks it with an {@i arcane lock}. For the next 24 hours, anyone besides you who touches the door is subjected to the {@i slow} spell (save DC 15). At the end of this time, the token disappears.

item.name: Quaal's Feather Token, Bridge
entries: You can use an action to toss the token over any gap 100 feet wide or narrower, and it will transform into a bridge of shimmering force. The bridge lasts for 24 hours or until you dismiss it.

item.name: Quaal's Feather Token, Crown
entries: You can use an action to activate this token, which garbs you in rich, noble-looking clothing and jewelry. The token also subtly affects your features and general bearing. Although you don't look any different, you take on a more noble mien. You have advantage on any Charisma skill check used to pose as or interact with nobility At the end of 24 hours, the clothes and token disappear.

item.name: Quaal's Feather Token, Eye
entries: If you affix this token over your eye, you gain truesight to a distance of 60 feet, can see magical auras, and can see into the Ethereal Plane to that range as well. In addition, you can't be blinded while wearing this token, and if you were blind in the eye on which you placed the token, the blindness in that eye is cured.

item.name: Quaal's Feather Token, Finger
entries: You can use an action to point the finger at a location you can see within 500 feet of you, and then say "there!" You are then teleported to that location and the token disappears.

item.name: Quaal's Feather Token, Jug (Type Ⅰ)
entries: You can use an action to turn this token into a jug. It will pour out pure water at a rate of 1 gallon each round for 1d4 minutes. Once it starts pouring, it won't stop producing water. At the end of this time, the jug dissolves into water droplets.

item.name: Quaal's Feather Token, Jug (Type Ⅱ)
entries: You can use an action to turn this token into a jug. It will pour out holy water at a rate of 1 pint each round for 1 minute. Once it starts pouring, it won't stop producing water. At the end of this time, the jug dissolves into water droplets.

item.name: Quaal's Feather Token, Key
entries: If you touch a wall, this token will create a permanent hallway, 10 feet wide × 10 feet high × 100 feet long. You can decide whether you want the hallway to end when it reaches a new passageway or chamber, or if you want it to continue to its full length. Optionally, you can instead use the key to safely open any locked, barred, or sealed door without triggering any protective magic on it. After using the key, it vanishes.

item.name: Quaal's Feather Token, Spoon
entries: You can use an action to turn this token into a plate of familiar, hearty food. The plate replenishes itself until it has produced enough food for 10 Medium creatures. The food can be taken off this plate and dished out to others. In addition, eating even a bite of this food will end the poisoned condition and will cure mummy rot.

item.name: Quaal's Feather Token, Sword
entries: This token turns into a full-sized longsword, which lasts for 1 hour before vanishing.

item.name: Quartermaster's Chest
entries: This huge, ironbound chest can provide nearly limitless quantities of supplies and equipment. It provides a different object each day. When you open the box, roll a d20 on the following table to determine what is currently in the chest.

rows: Bland but nutritious food for 100 people for 1 day.
30 planks of timber, each 2 inches × 6 inches × 3 feet.
A bolt of coarse, strong white cloth, 60 feet long and 3 feet wide.

Miscellaneous equipment, random items, and scraps of metal. No one piece weigh more than 5 pounds or is worth more than 1 gp. Examples include tins of armor polish, balls of string, whetstones, kindling, gaming dice, and so on.
Extremely tasty and nutritious food for 100 people for 1 day.
Low-quality and plain—but clean—clothing and/or blankets for 100 people and horses.

entries: Food removed from the {@i quartermaster's chest} lasts for 48 hours before going bad, and liquid that isn't removed from the chest drains away and evaporates after 24 hours.
Once the chest has been used, it can't be used again until the following dawn. Anything still in the chest at that time disappears.

item.name: Quill Pen of Copying
entries: To use this pen, you must first create ink by burning a spell scroll and mixing the ashes with high-quality ink worth at least 5 gp per level of spell. Then, if you dip the pen in the ink and lay it on two blank pieces of paper or parchment while speaking the command word, the pen will animate and write out two copies of the spell scroll you burned. This completely uses up the ink you make. Once you use the pen, you can't use it until 7 days have passed.

item.name: Quill Pen of Forgery
entries: To use this pen, you must first create ink by burning a piece of paper or parchment with a sample of the writing you wish to copy, then mixing the ashes with normal ink; the sample must contain at least 10 words. Then, if you dip the pen in the ink and lay it on a piece of paper or parchment while speaking the command word, the pen will write as you dictate, in a perfect copy of the writing you burned to make the ink. You can create up to 10 full sheets of writing at a time, and once you use the pen, you can't use it again until the following dusk.

item.name: Quill Pen of Long Writing
entries: This quill pen magically produces its own ink. You can concentrate on the pen for 1 round to make it change ink color or nib size.

item.name: Quill Pen of Necromancy
entries: To use this pen, you must first create ink by burning a bone (of any sort) and mixing the ashes with normal ink. Then, if you dip the pen in ink and lay it on a piece of paper and parchment which lies on top of a grave or directly on or next to a corpse (or urn containing cremated ashes), you may then use the pen to cast {@i speak with dead} on that dead person. The pen will then animate and write the answers. Once you use the pen, you can't use it again until the following dusk.

item.name: Quill Pen of Transcription
entries: This pen may be commanded to write down all words spoken within 30 feet of it. It will continue indefinitely until told to stop or it runs out of paper or ink. Verbal spell components and the command words for magical items are transcribed as a string of meaningless characters. If multiple voices are transcribed, the quill identifies them by their apparent race and sex, and the order in which they speak ("male human #2").

item.name: Rattle of Exorcism
entries: By shaking and rattling this symbol-painted gourd for 10 minutes while dancing around a possessed creature, you can use the gourd to cast {@i dispel evil and good}. If you have two rattles (you may attune to both and only use one attunement slot) and you cast the Dismissal version of the spell, the creature has disadvantage on its saving throw to resist you.

You may use the rattles up to two times each day: once to cast the Break Enchantment version, and once to cast the Dismissal version. Once you have cast one of those versions, you can't cast that version again until the following dawn.

item.name: Ring of Affliction
entries: This ring grants you resistance to one damage type while wearing it, as per the ring of resistance.

items.name: Curse
entries: This ring is cursed, and when you attune to it, it extends the curse to you. You may not remove this ring until dispel curse is cast on it.

While wearing this ring, you have vulnerability to one damage type (rolled on the table in the description for the ring of resistance) and disadvantage on saving throws against magic from one particular school.

item.name: Ring of Awareness
entries: While wearing this ring, you cannot be surprised, and you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks.

item.name: Ring of Bladeturning
entries: While wearing this weapon, you may use your reaction to attempt to deflect an incoming melee attack made by a metal weapon. By using your reaction, you may add +3 to your armor class to one attack each of your turns. You must be able to see the attack, although you don't have to be wielding a weapon yourself.

If you have the ability from either a class feature or a feat that allows you to use your reaction to parry or otherwise defend yourself from an attack by either adding your proficiency bonus to your AC or rolling a die and subtracting that amount from the damage taken, you may combine the effects of the {@i ring of bladeturning} with that ability in a single use of your reaction.

item.name: Ring of Blinking
entries: This ring has 5 charges and regains 1d4+1 charges each day at dawn. You may use your action to expend a charge to cast {@i blink}.

item.name: Ring of Cantrips, Type Ⅰ
entries: This ring has a random cantrip stored within it. While attuned to this ring, you may use your action to cast that cantrip. If you're a spellcaster, you use your own spell save DC (whether or not the cantrip is normally available to your class). Otherwise, the save DC is equal to 8 + your Charisma modifier + your proficiency bonus.

item.name: Ring of Cantrips, Type Ⅱ
entries: This ring has a {@dice 1d3+1} random cantrips stored within it. While attuned to this ring, you may use your action to cast these cantrips. If you're a spellcaster, you use your own spell save DC (whether or not the cantrip is normally available to your class). Otherwise, the save DC is equal to 8 + your Charisma modifier + your proficiency bonus.

item.name: Ring of Clear Thought
entries: While wearing this ring, your Intelligence increases by 1, to a maximum of 20. You also become resistant to psychic damage, immune to being charmed or frightened, and can't be put to sleep magically.

item.name: Ring of Clumsiness
entries: This ring appears to be, and functions as, a {@i ring of feather falling} or {@i ring of free action}.

items.name: Curse
entries: This ring is cursed, and attuning to it extends the curse to you. You may not remove this ring until dispel curse is cast on it.

When in combat with a dangerous enemy—a creature that constitutes a Medium or harder encounter difficulty for you—the ring's curse takes effect. You have disadvantage on Dexterity ability checks, Dexterity attack rolls, and Dexterity saving throws. In addition, if you have to make a concentration check when maintaining a spell, you have disadvantage on that roll.
After 1 hour, you no longer suffer from disadvantage on those rolls.

item.name: Ring of Command
entries: This ring has 3 charges and regains all expended charges each day at dawn. While you are wearing this ring, you may use your action to expend 1 or more charges to cast the following spells: {@i charm person} (1 charge), {@i command} (1 charge), and {@i suggestion} (2 charges).

item.name: Ring of Depetrification
entries: If you touch the large red ruby set in this ring to a statue of a creature that is petrified, you free that creature from that condition. Once the ring has been used, it can't be used again until the following dawn.

item.name: Ring of Extension
entries: This ring contains 5 charges and regains 1d4+1 charges each day at dawn. You may use a bonus action to expend a charge and double the range of any spell that has a range of 5 feet or greater. Optionally, you can extend a charge and change a spell that normally has a range of Touch so that it instead has a range of 30 feet.

item.name: Ring of Fearlessness
entries: While wearing this ring, you are immune to being frightened.

items.name: Curse
entries: This ring is cursed, and attuning yourself to the ring extends the curse to you. As long as you are cursed, you can't remove the ring.

While cursed, you will be convinced you can handle any situation, no matter how difficult or unlikely. You won't be compelled to do anything you believe goes against your sense of morality (i.e., if you're good-aligned, you won't suddenly decide to torch an orphanage), but if it's something you normally wouldn't do because you know success was unlikely (such as stopping the rampaging dragon or challenging the archmage for leadership when you're just an apprentice), you will do it, certain that you're up to the task.
You also don't become delusional and believe you have gained new abilities, but you will be convinced you know the best way to direct your allies.
If your DM requires "common sense" ability checks at times in order to help prevent you from doing incredibly stupid things, you make these checks at disadvantage.

item.name: Ring of Fire Starting, Type Ⅰ
entries: This ring is set with a large, slightly warm red gemstone and glows with a faint inner light. On command, it will shed bright light to a radius of 5 feet and dim light for a further 5 feet.
This ring allows you to cast the {@i create bonfire} and {@i control flames} cantrips.

item.name: Ring of Fire Starting, Type Ⅱ
entries: This ring is set with a large, slightly warm red gemstone and glows with a faint inner light. On command, it will shed bright light to a radius of 5 feet and dim light for a further 5 feet.
This ring allows you to cast the {@i create bonfire} and {@i control flames} cantrips.

In addition to the above powers, you may use the ring to cast {@i conjure elementals}. You can only conjure fire elementals while using it. If you lose control of the elemental, it simply returns to its own plane rather than turning hostile.

item.name: Ring of Flying
entries: This ring has 3 charges and regains all expended charges each day at dawn. When you use an action to expend a charge, you may cast {@i fly} on yourself.

item.name: Ring of Gargoyles
entries: You may use your action to command the ring to cast a variant of {@i conjure minor elementals} which causes 1d4+1 gargoyles to appear. Once you have done so, you can't do so again until the following dusk.

Additionally, as an action, you can see through one gargoyle's eyes and hear what it hears until the start of your next turn, gaining the gargoyle's darkvision. During this time, you are deaf and blind with regard to your own senses. You can use a bonus action to switch to a different gargoyle, or return to your own senses.

item.name: Ring of Glyphs
entries: You may use your action to command the ring to inscribe a {@i symbol}, as per the spell. Once you have done so, you can't do so again until the following dawn.

item.name: Ring of Immunity
entries: While wearing this ring, you are immune to all diseases, even diseases caused by spells such as {@i contagion} or diseases caused by curses, such as lycanthropy and mummy rot.

item.name: Ring of Light
entries: While wearing this ring, you can use a bonus action to cast the {@i light} cantrip.

item.name: Ring of Liquid Identification
entries: This ring is set with a clear rock crystal. If you dip the crystal in a liquid, it will change colors, depending on the nature of the liquid.

item.name: Ring of Many Cantrips
entries: This ring has 1d3+1 random cantrips stored within it. While attuned to this ring, you may use your action to cast one of these cantrips. If you're a spellcaster, you use your own spell save DC (whether or not the cantrip is normally available to your class). Otherwise, the save DC is equal to 8 + your Charisma modifier + your proficiency bonus.

item.name: Ring of Quick Action
item.reqAttune: by a barbarian, fighter, ranger, or paladin
entries: While wearing this ring, you have advantage on initiative rolls. If you are wearing this ring while attuned to a {@i blade of quickness} (q.v.) or a {@i scimitar of speed}, you always go first in initiative, unless you choose not to.

item.name: Ring of Readiness
entries: This is a set of two iron rings: one is a small ring to be worn on your finger, and the other is a larger one which must be attached to an inanimate object that weighs 100 pounds of less.

As long as you wear the smaller ring and are within 100 miles of the larger ring, you may use your action to call the larger ring and the object to which it is attached to you. If the object is a weapon, it appears in your hand. If it's a suit of armor, it appears on you (unless you're already wearing armor, in which case it appears next to you). For any other type of object, it appears on or near you in a way that facilitates it being used immediately.
You may remove the larger ring and place it on a new object at any time.

item.name: Ring of Shapechanging, Type Ⅰ
entries: This ring has 3 charges and regains all expended charges each day at dawn. It comes in three varieties, all of which let you use your action to cast {@i shapechange} on yourself. While in your new form, the ring merges with your new body.
This {@i ring of shapechanging} allows you to assume the form of a single type of beast of CR 4 or lower. The type of beast is set and can't be changed.

item.name: Ring of Shapechanging, Type Ⅱ
entries: This ring has 3 charges and regains all expended charges each day at dawn. It comes in three varieties, all of which let you use your action to cast {@i shapechange} on yourself. While in your new form, the ring merges with your new body.

This ring allows you assume the form of a single type of monstrosity that has an Intelligence of 4 or lower and a CR of 5 or lower, such as a griffon or gorgon. The type of monstrosity is set and can't be changed.

item.name: Ring of Shapechanging, Type Ⅲ
entries: This ring has 3 charges and regains all expended charges each day at dawn. It comes in three varieties, all of which let you use your action to cast {@i shapechange} on yourself. While in your new form, the ring merges with your new body.
This ring allows you to become anything you want, within the confines of the {@i shapechange} spell.

item.name: Ring of Shocking Grasp
entries: While attuned to this ring, you can use your action to cast {@i shocking grasp}.

item.name: Ring of Sustenance
entries: While wearing this ring, you need only half as much food, drink, and sleep as normal. This doesn't affect the length of time that elves (or other creatures that don't sleep) must rest or trance.

item.name: Ring of the Fair Folk
entries: This ring gives you several abilities related to fey. You can speak, read, and write Sylvan, have advantage on Intelligence (Arcana), Charisma (Deception), and Charisma (Persuasion) skill checks when dealing with fey, and on Wisdom (Survival) ability checks when you are in the Feywild.

In addition, you may use your action to use the ring to cast the following spells: {@i commune with nature}, {@i conjure fey}, {@i enlarge/reduce}, or {@i greater invisibility}. Once you have cast one of these spells, you can't cast any other spells with the ring until the following dusk.

item.name: Ring of Tongues
entries: While wearing this ring, you can understand, read, write, and speak all languages.

item.name: Ring of Truth
entries: While you wear this ring, you automatically detect any deliberate lie that is told to you, but at the same time, you yourself can't lie.

items.name: Curse
entries: Some, but not all, of these rings are cursed, and once you wear it, you cannot take it off until {@i remove curse} or a similar spell is cast on you.

item.name: Robe of Holding
entries: This robe has 1d20+10 pockets, each of which is extradimensional and can hold up to 10 pounds.
由于这个东西采用了超维空间，把它放在一个{@i bag of holding}或类似的物体里会导致两个物品都被摧毁，并且打开一个通往星界的裂缝。

item.name: Robe of Stone
entries: This robe has 3 charges. You may use your action to expend a charge and command the outer surface of the robe to become as hard as rock for 1 minute, giving you resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons. The robe itself remains flexible.
The robe regains all expended charges each day at dawn.

item.name: Robe of the Arctic Wastes
entries: While wearing this off-white robe, you are unharmed and unhindered by nonmagical cold weather.

item.name: Robe of the Desert
entries: While wearing this beige robe, you are unharmed and unhindered by nonmagical hot weather.

item.name: Robe of Vanishing
entries: This robe has 3 charges. You may use your action to expend an action and pull the robe's hood over your face. This causes you to vanish into an extradimensional space, much like the one in the {@i rope trick} spell. You may remain in this space for 1 hour before being expelled from it.
Unlike the {@i rope trick} spell, you can move while in the {@i robe of vanishing}. However, your speed is halved.
The robe regains all expended charges each day at dawn.

item.name: Rocksplitter
entries: You gain +2 to hit and damage with this weapon.
If you strike unworked earth or stone on the ground, you may use your action to cast {@i earthquake}. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until the next dawn.

As long as you are attuned to {@i rocksplitter}, you won't fall prone when you cast this spell, or because of an {@i earthquake} or {@i earth tremor} spell cast by someone else, or because of a naturally-occuring earthquake.

item.name: Rod of Beguiling
entries: This rod has 5 charges. When you hold it, you can use an action to expend a charge to cause all creatures within 20 feet to be charmed by you. A creature may make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw to resist. If you or your allies harm a charmed creature, it may make a new saving throw, ending the effect on a success. A charmed creature views you as a friend to be trusted and heeded, and will view all your actions in the best possible light. The charm lasts for 1 hour, and afterwards, the creature isn't aware it was charmed.
The rod regains 1 expended charge daily at dawn. If the rod is reduced to 0 charges, roll a d20. On a 1, the rod disappears in a burst of radiance.

item.name: Rod of Building
entries: To use this item, you must have a detailed architectural plan of a building you wish to be constructed that is no larger than 100 feet on a side. The plans should include not only the shape of the building but any designs, color schemes, and ornamentation you want the building to have. Then, using the rod, you trace the outside dimensions of the building's foundation on the ground. Upon completing this, the rod will cause the building to construct itself, brick by brick, using only the earth, air, and pure magical power as material.

The basic building is constructed at a rate of a 5-foot cube every minute, and the process continues until the entire building as depicted on your plans is built. (Ornamentation takes an additional 1 minute per 5-foot cube).

Until the building is complete, it is magical. An {@i antimagic field} or similar effect will destroy the part of the building that overlaps with the {@i field}, and a {@i counterspell}, cast with a 8th- or 9th-level spell slot, can be cast to attempt to stop the construction and destroy what has already been built.If the plans are destroyed before the building is complete, the rod stops building.
Once the building is fully constructed, the rod can't be used again for 30 days. In addition, roll a d20. On a 1, the rod falls into pieces and becomes nonmagical.

item.name: Rod of Death
entries: This rod has 5 charges. You may use this rod as a magic club. On a successful hit, you can expend 1 or more charges to inflict an additional 30 points of necrotic damage per charge spent. If your target is undead, it inflicts radiant damage instead of necrotic damage.

A living humanoid that dies because of the necrotic damage will rise 1d4 rounds later as a zombie (it its CR was 2 or lower) or a wight (if its CR was 3 or higher). The undead is charmed by you for 24 hours, after which it stops obeying your commands. It doesn't automatically attack you, however. You can spend 1 charge to reassert control over up to two zombies or one wight you created through
You can also expend 1 or more charges to cast {@i animate dead} (1 charge), {@i create undead} (3 charges), or {@i Abi-Dalzim's horrid wilting} (5 charges).
The rod regains 1d4 expended charge daily at dawn. If the rod is reduced to 0 charges, roll a d20. On a 1, the rod crumbles to ash.

item.name: Rod of Health
entries: This rod has 3 charges. You can use your action to expend a charge to cast {@i cure wounds} (healing 3d8 hit points) or {@i lesser restoration}, or you can expend 4 charges to cast {@i greater restoration}.
The rod regains 1d3 expended charge daily at dawn. If the rod is reduced to 0 charges, roll a d20. On a 1, the rod crumbles to ash.

item.name: Rod of Justice
entries: This iron rod functions as a {@i mace +1}. On command, you can choose to force your target to make a 17 Constitution saving throw instead of taking damage.
